intro: Melampodium nayaritense, commonly known as the Nayarit everlasting pea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy yellow-orange flowers that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are often arranged in clusters. Melampodium nayaritense is known for its long-lasting blooms, which remain intact even when dried, making it a popular choice for floral arrangements.
